intro: Thaspium verticillatum, commonly known as the clustered false pennyroyal, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale purple flowers in whorled clusters, which are typical of the genus Thaspium. It thrives in sandy or well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal uses, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
